title: feat: Add support for includeInBoardPinout
description: Adds support for the includeInBoardPinout property within pinAttributes, allowing ports with this attribute to be marked as board pinouts in the circuit output.
body:
This pull request adds support for the includeInBoardPinout property within pinAttributes.                                                                         

When a port on a component has the includeInBoardPinout: true attribute, the corresponding pcb_port in the circuit output will have its is_board_pinout flag set to true.                                                                                                                                                              

A new test file has been added to verify this functionality.

RE https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/788

body: related https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/768

title: feat: platedhole offsets for holes in  plated pads
description: Normalizes hole offsets for plated holes in rectangular pads and removes legacy handling for PCB hole offsets.
body:
## Summary
- normalize `holeOffsetX`/`holeOffsetY` in the plated hole constructor so parsed props always carry numeric offsets for rectangular pad variants
- consume the normalized offsets in each plated-hole branch and drop the legacy `pcbHoleOffset*` handling when rebuilding from circuit JSON
- narrow the hole primitive typings back to the circular path while leaving its runtime behavior unchanged

## Testing
- `bun test tests/components/primitive-components/pcb-circular-hole-rect-plated-offset-hole.test.tsx`
- `bunx tsc --noEmit`

title: refactor the pinout SVG generation logic
description: Refactors the pinout SVG generation logic for improved code organization and readability by creating utility functions and encapsulating complex logic into separate modules.
body:
for improved code organization and readability

 • Created lib/pinout/pinout-utils.ts to house utility functions getPortLabelInfo and getClosestEdge.                
 • Created lib/pinout/calculate-label-positions.ts to encapsulate the complex logic for calculating pin label        
   positions.                                                                                                        
 • Updated lib/pinout/convert-circuit-json-to-pinout-svg.ts to use the new, extracted modules, significantly         
   simplifying its implementation.

title: feat(pinout): Implement convertCircuitJsonToPinoutSvg generator
description: This PR introduces a new SVG generator, convertCircuitJsonToPinoutSvg, to create pinout diagrams from circuit-json. This feature is designed to produce clear, human-readable reference diagrams for physical board connections.  New Top-Level Converter: Adds convertCircuitJsonToPinoutSvg to the public API, which generates a complete SVG string.  Automatic Label Layout:  Ports marked with is_board_pinout: true are identified and labeled.  Labels are automatically grouped by the nearest board edge (top, bottom, left, right).  A layout algorithm organizes labels along each edge, using staggering and elbow connectors for leader lines to ensure clarity and avoid overlap.  Board Element Rendering: The diagram renders key physical features from the circuit-json, including:  pcb_board with complex outlines and cutouts.  pcb_smtpad (rect, circle, polygon, etc.).  pcb_plated_hole (circle, pill, etc.).  pcb_hole.  A representation of pcb_component footprints.  Comprehensive Testing: Unit tests with SVG snapshot validation have been added to cover various board shapes and pin configurations.
body:
This PR introduces a new SVG generator, convertCircuitJsonToPinoutSvg, to create pinout diagrams from circuit-json.  
This feature is designed to produce clear, human-readable reference diagrams for physical board connections.         

 • New Top-Level Converter: Adds convertCircuitJsonToPinoutSvg to the public API, which generates a complete SVG     
   string.                                                                                                           
 • Automatic Label Layout:                                                                                           
    • Ports marked with is_board_pinout: true are identified and labeled.                                            
    • Labels are automatically grouped by the nearest board edge (top, bottom, left, right).                         
    • A layout algorithm organizes labels along each edge, using staggering and elbow connectors for leader lines to 
      ensure clarity and avoid overlap.                                                                              
 • Board Element Rendering: The diagram renders key physical features from the circuit-json, including:              
    • pcb_board with complex outlines and cutouts.                                                                   
    • pcb_smtpad (rect, circle, polygon, etc.).                                                                      
    • pcb_plated_hole (circle, pill, etc.).                                                                          
    • pcb_hole.                                                                                                      
    • A representation of pcb_component footprints.                                                                  
 • Comprehensive Testing: Unit tests with SVG snapshot validation have been added to cover various board shapes and  
   pin configurations.

/claim [#788](https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/788)
/closes [#788](https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/788)

title: fix: prevent file selector from hiding top tabs on small screens
description: fixes 1168  Summary Centers the file selector without absolute positioning and constrains its width with truncation so it no longer overlaps or hides the PCBSchematic3D tabs on narrow viewports.  Changes libcomponentsRunFrameWithApiRunFrameWithApi.tsx Replace absolute-centered wrapper with flex-centered wrapper so the selector participates in layout. libcomponentsRunFrameWithApifile-selector-combobox.tsx Add responsive max-width, ellipsis truncation, and keep natural width otherwise.  Rationale Absolute positioning caused the file selector to float above and obscure the tabs at small widths. Letting it flow in flex with truncation keeps all controls accessible.  Risks Extremely narrow widths may still feel tight. Tabs now remain tappable, but we may want a future responsive collapse as CircuitJsonPreview cuts off to the right on smaller screens.
body:
fixes #1168 ### Summary Centers the file selector without absolute positioning and constrains its width with truncation so it no longer overlaps or hides the PCB/Schematic/3D tabs on narrow viewports. ### Changes - `lib/components/RunFrameWithApi/RunFrameWithApi.tsx` - Replace absolute-centered wrapper with flex-centered wrapper so the selector participates in layout. ```158:174:lib/components/RunFrameWithApi/RunFrameWithApi.tsx leftHeaderContent={
{props.leftHeaderContent} {props.showFilesSwitch && (
{ if (typeof fsMap.get(value) === "string") { setComponentPath(value) } }} />
)}
} ``` - `lib/components/RunFrameWithApi/file-selector-combobox.tsx` - Add responsive max-width, ellipsis truncation, and keep natural width otherwise. ```32:42:lib/components/RunFrameWithApi/file-selector-combobox.tsx ``` ### Rationale - Absolute positioning caused the file selector to float above and obscure the tabs at small widths. - Letting it flow in flex with truncation keeps all controls accessible. ### Screenshots - Before: selector overlaps “3D” tab and content. - After: selector centered; tabs remain visible; long paths truncated with ellipsis. ### Testing - Manually verified at ~320–1440 px widths. - Verified popover search and selection still work. - No linter errors. ### Risks - Extremely narrow widths may still feel tight. Tabs now remain tappable, but we may want a future responsive collapse as `CircuitJsonPreview` cuts off to the right on smaller screens. ### Follow-ups - Discuss whether the `CircuitJsonPreview` should move into a kebab menu on xs widths to keep it fully selectable. /claim #1168

title: feat(spice): add simulate and export spice commands
description: Add commands to run circuit simulations and export results in SPICE and CSV formats from the CLI.
body: This pull request introduces two new features for running circuit simulations directly from the CLI. A new simulate command has been added to allow users to quickly run simulations and view the results. • Usage: tsci simulate analog • Functionality: • Runs a transient SPICE simulation on the provided .tsx file. • Outputs a formatted, aligned table of the simulation results directly to the console. • Simulation is performed using the eecircuit-engine library. The export spice commandautomatically runs a simulation and saves the results. • Usage: tsci export -f spice • Functionality: • Exports the .spice.cir file. • Additionally, it runs a simulation and saves the results to a .csv file with the same base name. • A single console message confirms the creation of both files. Technical Details • A runSimulation utility has been created to handle fetching, initializing, and running the eecircuit-engine WASM-based simulator. • The initialization process now uses a polling mechanism to reliably start the simulation engine. • Helper functions (resultToCsv and resultToTable) have been added to parse and format the simulation output, automatically handling duplicate data columns from the engine. simulate command: /claim #348 /closes #348
